StringTable.Label: STATDEC_HitPointsCap
StringTable.String: Maximum Hitpoints our ships can have

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Intimidation
StringTable.String: Intimidation is used to manipulate others into doing what you want out of fear. It can be used against other civilizations to improve trade deals, as well as to force events to go your way. It is a powerful tool, but when it fails the targets won't be quick to forget what you tried to do.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Persuasion
StringTable.String: Persuasion is an ability we can use while trading with other civilizations. It increases the perceived value of our trade.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_RandomTechSlots
StringTable.String: Controls the number of available technologies than can be selected for research.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Approval
StringTable.String: Approval is a measure of how your citizens view your government. It can be affected by your [HS=HS_Taxes]Tax Rate[/HS], [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS], [HS=HS_Crime]Crime[/HS], and much more. Different species have different motivations so check out your citizens to see what is liked and disliked.[BR][BR]Your planet's Approval is the average Approval of all of the citizens on that planet.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_FundedProduction
StringTable.String: Maximum production available when you are fully funded.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_FundedResearch
StringTable.String: Maximum production available when you are fully funded.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Military
StringTable.String: This is how much production a world contributes to the local Shipyard.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Research
StringTable.String: The higher your Research, the faster you learn new technologies. Research is provided by your world's [HS=HS_NaturalResources]Natural Resources[/HS] and boosted by research improvements and scientists.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_EmporiumFavor
StringTable.String: The Endless Emporium is faction that controls intergalactic trade.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_NaturalLeagueFavor
StringTable.String: The Natural League is a growing movement that rejects cybernetics and synthetic life of all types.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_WarforgedFavor
StringTable.String: The Warforged is a growing movement that believes that only the strong survive.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ProductionPoints
StringTable.String: Your planet's Raw Production is used to power Manufacturing, Research, and Wealth.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_InfluencePerTurn
StringTable.String: Your planet's Cultural output defines Influence on the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ColonyGrossIncome
StringTable.String: The number of Credits your worlds generate. The proportion that goes into your treasury is based on your Tax Rate.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Mining
StringTable.String: The total number of resources collected from strategic resources gathered by your starbases per month.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ColonyTaxRevenue
StringTable.String: Income gathered from this world is affected by both the Wealth of the world, and the Tax Rate you have set.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Influence
StringTable.String: Influence controls the spread of your civilization's borders. With a high enough Influence, you can overwhelm another civilization's borders and even flip their worlds to your control.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Growth
StringTable.String: Once enough Growth is generated on your world, a new citizen is created. Pollution will reduce the Growth of a world, while Fertility Clinics and other population improvements can increase it.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Tourism
StringTable.String: Half of your Tourism gets applied to your [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] and half to your [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Tourism_Supernova
StringTable.String: Tourism increases how much [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] you gain, based on how large your Zone of Control is.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TourismIncome
StringTable.String: Tourism Income gets applied to your [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS].

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Food
StringTable.String: Planets produce food that is consumed by your organic citizens. To get more, colonize new worlds, or specialize your citizens into Farmers.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Population
StringTable.String: The number of citizens that live on your world.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_PopulationCap
StringTable.String: This represents the maximum number of citizens that can live on this world.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefense
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_PlanetaryDefense]Planetary Defense[/HS] [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] increase a Colony's ability to resist Invasion and extend how long it takes an invading [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the Colony.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ResistanceBonus
StringTable.String: Resistance measures how resilient a Colony is to foreign [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS]. A higher Resistance will cause it to take longer for a Colony to rebel when in another Civilization's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS].

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefensesHP
StringTable.String: A rating of how powerful the Colony's defenses are. Higher [HS=HS_PlanetaryDefense]Planetary Defenses[/HS] cause Invasions to take more [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] and require [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] to have higher [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Ratings to try to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the Colony.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefensesMaxHP
StringTable.String: A rating of how powerful the Colony's defenses are. Higher [HS=HS_PlanetaryDefense]Planetary Defenses[/HS] cause Invasions to take more [HS=HS_Months]Turns[/HS] and require [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] to have higher [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Ratings to try to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the Colony.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefensesRepairAbility
StringTable.String: The percentage of your max planetary defense hit points you can regain each week.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TotalShipAttack
StringTable.String: Damage a sieging ship can do to a besieged planet.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TradeLicensesMax
StringTable.String: Trade Licenses are required to establish Trade Routes with other worlds.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Diplomacy
StringTable.String: Diplomacy Bonus is a modifier on your relations with other civilizations. A higher Diplomacy will make them more likely to trade with you and to offer you [HS=HS_Treaties]Treaties[/HS], while less likely to declare war on you. Each civilization leader has their own personality, and will evaluate their relationship with you differently.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_DiplomaticCapital
StringTable.String: Diplomatic Capital is a currency that can be used with other factions during Trading.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_DiplomaticCapitalCost
StringTable.String: Diplomatic Capital is a currency that can be used with other factions during Trading.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_DiplomaticCapitalIncome
StringTable.String: Diplomatic Capital is a currency that can be used with other factions during Trading.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_HitPoints
StringTable.String: The amount of damage a ship can take before it is destroyed.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_SensorRange
StringTable.String: Determines from how far away this object can see other objects like anomalies and enemy ships.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Logistics
StringTable.String: Logistics determines how many ships can operate together in a fleet. Every ship has a Logistics cost, and every player has a Logistics value. Generally, larger ships cost more Logistics then smaller ships.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_MovesCap
StringTable.String: Maximum distance your ships can move in a single turn. Ships get a 50% move bonus if they start their turn in friendly territory.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_SiegeAbility
StringTable.String: A measure of a ship's ability to subdue an enemy planet.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Level
StringTable.String: The benefits of an improvement advance alongisde the level. Placing an improvement type on its ideal terrain, or placing it adjacent to other improvements that support it, will improve its level.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Maintenance
StringTable.String: The cost of maintaining structures and other elements of core worlds and colonies.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ManufacturingCost
StringTable.String: This is how much Manufacturing it takes to construct.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_Manufacturing
StringTable.String: The higher your Manufacturing, the faster you will be able to build improvements on planets and ships in your shipyards.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ManufacturingOverflow
StringTable.String: Surplus production available to be used on the next project.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ShipRange
StringTable.String: Distance non-probe ships can travel away from our planets and starbases.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Soldiering
StringTable.String: Reduces the time it takes to invade worlds.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Wealth
StringTable.String: Wealth is a measure of a planet's rare and valuable resources.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ModifierValue
StringTable.String: Increases the rate of benefit we receive from Precursor relics.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_LeaderMaxRecruits
StringTable.String: Modifies the number of leaders from which we can recruit.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_LeaderCostModify
StringTable.String: Modifies the cost to recruit new leaders.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_SecurityLevel
StringTable.String: Counter intelligence Spies are dedicated to protecting us from threats, both domestic and alien, who wish to steal our technologies. Leaders can be temporarily assigned in the Govern screen to increase our vigilance.[BR][BR]Assign more citizens to Counter Intelligence, to slow down or prevent foreign spies from stealing our technology.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_Population
StringTable.String: How much your population grows per month.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_ColonyNetIncome
StringTable.String: How many galactic credits your colonies are generating each turn. A percentage of this goes into your treasury based on your Tax Rate.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_ShipRangeUnderride
StringTable.String: Matches the range of the fleet it is in.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_MovesCapUnderride
StringTable.String: Matches the speed of the fleet it is in.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_TriggerAndNoShipBattle
StringTable.String: Will trigger an effect instead of battling when attacking.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_Administration
StringTable.String: Administrators are required for making constructors, colony ships, and survey ships. Specialize your citizens into Administrators to gain more Administration.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_PoliticalCapital
StringTable.String: Political Capital can be used in trade, or to convince other players to vote for you in the United Planets.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_LegionsAvailable
StringTable.String: Legions available to invade planets, or to defend your own planet with a General

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Minerals
StringTable.String: Minerals are a measure of a planet's raw mineral resources available to be directly applied to constructing improvements and ships.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Technology
StringTable.String: Technology is a rare natural resource that reflects the unusual and most interesting aspects of a planet. Scientists can study these to forward our research.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Fertility
StringTable.String: Fertility represents the amount of biological life the planet supports. This is critical for generating enough food to feed our citizens.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_PlanetInfluence
StringTable.String: Cultural Significance represents a planet's potential to generate influence, expanding your borders.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ColonySponsorDecayMod
StringTable.String: Percentage of resource output lost due to inefficiencies on the way to the sponsored core world.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanAssassinateDiplomats
StringTable.String: Allows you to assassinate diplomats assigned to you.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Crime
StringTable.String: Crime reduces the Income of your colony, as well as making it more likely to produce new citizens as criminals, which in turn raise Crime. Citizens will also suffer an Approval penalty if Crime is too high.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Pollution
StringTable.String: Quality of the environment on the planet. High Pollution reduces the [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] of citizens and the production of [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS].

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Control
StringTable.String: Your ability to force immediate effects, such as protest suppression, construction rushing, and executive orders. Generate Control through events, ideology traits, and special improvements.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_MaxEnactedPolicies
StringTable.String: Hard limit on the number of policies that you can enact at once.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Intelligence
StringTable.String: Intelligence modifies [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] and related tasks. For leaders, Intelligence is important for a Minister of Technology and for [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS] of technology-focused worlds.[BR][BR]For citizens, Intelligence is important for scientists.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Social
StringTable.String: Social modifies a leader's skill at [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] and [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] tasks. A high Social skill is important for diplomats, Ministers of Colonization, and [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS].[BR][BR]For citizens, Social is important for entertainers and traders.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Diligence
StringTable.String: Diligence modifies a leader's skill at production related tasks. A high Diligence is important for [HS=HS_Commander]Commanders[/HS] and for [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS] of [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS]-based worlds.[BR][BR]For citizens, Diligence is important for workers and farmers

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Resolve
StringTable.String: Resolve modifies a leader's skill at military tasks. A high Resolve makes for a powerful [HS=HS_Commander]Commander[/HS].[BR][BR]For citizens, Resolve is important for Soldiers. All of the Resolve from a world's citizens adds to that planet's [HS=HS_Resistance]Resistance[/HS]

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Expectations
StringTable.String: Expectations modify the [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] of a citizen. Citizens with high Expectations will need entertainment and luxury resources, while those with low Expectations are much easier to keep happy.[BR][BR]Specializing a unit will increase its Expectations.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Loyalty
StringTable.String: Loyalty is a leader's opinion of you.[BR][BR]A leader with a Loyalty below 30 is at risk of resigning, or attempting to undermine you. A leader with an extremely high loyalty may offer additional support and help.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ApprovalFromSoldierUnits
StringTable.String: Approval provided by citizens assigned to be Soldiers.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostTotalitarianism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Totalitarianism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostIndividualism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Individualism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostTraditionalism
StringTable.String: Traditionalism Points cost for next Tradition Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostProgressivism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Progressivism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostPacifism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Pacifism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostCollectivism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Collectivism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostNihilism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Nihilism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceTotalitarianism
StringTable.String: Count of Totalitarianism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceTraditionalism
StringTable.String: Count of Traditionalism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceProgressivism
StringTable.String: Count of Progressivism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoicePacifism
StringTable.String: Count of Pacifism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceEgalitarianism
StringTable.String: Count of Egalitarianism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceCollectivism
StringTable.String: Count of Collectivism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceIndividualism
StringTable.String: Count of Individualism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceNihilism
StringTable.String: Count of Nihilism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IgnoreRushLimit
StringTable.String: Let the player rush as many projects as they can afford.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_RushCosts
StringTable.String: A bonus modifier to the cost of rushing a project.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ApprovalFromClericUnits
StringTable.String: Approval provided by Clerics on your planets.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ApprovalFromScientistUnits
StringTable.String: Approval bonus from having Scientists on a colony.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_AOERange
StringTable.String: Radius of area when area-of-effect modifiers are applied on the map.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Prestige
StringTable.String: Measure of progress towards galactic domination.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ThinktankFavor
StringTable.String: Improved thinktank favor results in better bonuses for you from the assigned leaders.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BazaarDiscount
StringTable.String: Discount when buying at the Galactic Bazaar. (Max Effect: 50%)

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreAtWarWithHomeworld
StringTable.String: Citizens of planets you have conquered no longer give an approval hit if you are war with their species.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_IntimidationBonus
StringTable.String: Increases the effectiveness of your intimidation tactics.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreDiploPenaltyAtWarWithFriend
StringTable.String: Other civilizations ignore when you are at war with their friends.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreDiploPenaltyTradingWithEnemy
StringTable.String: Other civilizations ignore when you are trading with their enemy.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_TechRandomOfferDiscountBonus
StringTable.String: An additional boost to the research discount offered on random techs.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TotalAttack
StringTable.String: Total attack power across all weapon types

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TotalDefense
StringTable.String: Total defense power across all defense types

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Conquest
StringTable.String: Measure of a fleet's effectiveness at laying siege on an enemy planet

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BazaarPremium
StringTable.String: Premium when selling at the Galactic Bazaar.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ThinktankPremium
StringTable.String: Bonus to the benefits of Thinktanks.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreThinktankPenalties
StringTable.String: Ignore the negative effects of Thinktanks.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_IsAtWar
StringTable.String: Is player at war with anyone?

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_IsAtPeace
StringTable.String: Is player at peace with everyone?

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_GovernorColonyStatsPremium
StringTable.String: Boost to the Colony Stats affected by a Governor.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BattleRating
StringTable.String: Combination of weapon power, fire rates, ranges, defense capabilities, and hit point capacity, indicating general battle effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BattleRating_SpecComp
StringTable.String: The combat rating of components with unique and specialized offensive capabilities.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BattleRating_DefOnly
StringTable.String: Combination of weapon power, fire rates, ranges, defense capabilities, and hit point capacity, indicating general battle effectiveness.[BR][BR]This variant of the modifier only applied when weapons are present.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_OwnedClustersCount
StringTable.String: Number of Sectors the faction has majority control over.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_WarWeariness
StringTable.String: Your citizens grow weary of being at war for so long.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_AssaultAttack
StringTable.String: A measure of how many assault troops are available. Assault troops are used to take over vessels. Assault Attack Troops can be countered with Assault Defense Troops.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_AssaultDefense
StringTable.String: A measure of how many defense troops are available. Defense troops defend vessels from boarding actions, preventing ships from being taken over. Assault Defense Troops are used to counter Assault Attack Troops.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_AssaultRange
StringTable.String: The effective range of assault shuttles. The Assault Range is how far assault shuttles can travel to another ship to initiate a boarding action.

StringTable.Label: HS_Treaties_Desc
StringTable.String: Treaties are mutually beneficial agreements established between friendly civilizations through trade.[BR][BR]The ability to establish Treaties is an important function of [HS=HS_Diplomacy]Diplomacy[/HS]
